intro: Cyrtandra oenobarba, commonly known as the hairy Cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests. Cyrtandra oenobarba is often found growing on rocky substrates or in mountainous regions.
